kinda hacky, but does the job :slightly_smiling_face:

Hey everyone,

Is it possible to hide modules in the page creation tool based on a portal?
To give some context, I develop modules that are then deployed via the cli on two portals. (these modules can be used on both environments).

However, I have a module that must be present on one portal, what can I do to hide it on the other one?

Tell me if u don't understand my issue... Thanks :slightly_smiling_face:
I’m reading through all the webpack docs to try to understand more (shocking!). I think I need it to really try to maximize performance.
This should help me I think: <https://github.com/shakacode/sass-resources-loader>
It’s generally working great…pulling my hair out over one weird scss file though.
Using my media query mixin breaks everything after the mixin
I’m somehow getting a empty media query at the end that is breaking combination on the HubSpot side
(also, probably unrelated to this thread sorry)

Is there any chance at all that there is something wrong with the HubSpot CSS Combinator? If I look at my file and run lint on it…everything is fine. When I look at it on the website there’s a blank media query being added to the end

I messaged <@U26AKMZ19> with a better description of the problem. Generally, somewhere between compiling SCSS, running webpack, and rendering CSS…a CSS #id with a nested SCSS mixin breaks the HubSpot CSS combine
